motions.title: Consent Agenda Approval
motions.description: Approval of consent agenda including: • October 28, 2024 meeting minutes • Stage Door Players legal entity change • Skate park mural surplus • On-call contract for materials testing, geotechnical and environmental services • Funding authorization for 4525 Sudbury Road stormwater repairs

motions.title: Remove Treetop Quest Item from Table
motions.description: Motion to remove the Treetop Quest Dunwoody Renewal Agreement from the table (previously tabled at 10.28.24 meeting).

motions.title: Treetop Quest Dunwoody Renewal Agreement
motions.description: Approval of Treetop Quest renewal agreement after addressing safety incident concerns.

motions.title: SLUP 24-01 Starbucks Drive-Through (Second Read)
motions.description: Second read approval of Special Land Use Permit for Starbucks drive-through facility at 140 Perimeter Center West.

motions.title: Motion to Enter Executive Session
motions.description: Motion to enter executive session for litigation and real estate discussion.

publicHearings.title: Charter Amendment Article II, Section 2.13(a)(4) - Prohibitions (First Read)
publicHearings.description: First read of charter amendment to allow Police Foundation and similar organizations to support officers and families in need. Does not apply to elected officials.

publicHearings.title: Charter Amendment Article II, Section 2.13(e) - Prohibitions (First Read)
publicHearings.description: First read of charter amendment to prohibit elected officials from working for DeKalb County or City of Dunwoody (Harris recused herself).

specialEvents.title: Citizens' Police Academy Class XV Graduation Recognition
specialEvents.description: Recognition of seventeen graduates from thirteen-week Citizens' Police Academy program, with Officer Hernandez recruiting three new volunteers.

presentations.title: Dunwoody Community Garden & Orchard Annual Presentation
presentations.description: Fifteenth year operation report showing 100 members, successful spring plant sale with 800+ shoppers, greenhouse upgrades, and strong financial position.
presentations.presenter: Ann Bone (Chair) and Richard Osterholtz (Greenhouse Manager)

discussionItems.title: Construction Manager at Risk Contract for Brook Run Maintenance Facility
discussionItems.description: Recommendation for Moeller-Purcell as Construction Manager at $4,500/month for 2-3 month preconstruction phase, with March/April 2025 start date anticipated.

discussionItems.title: 2025 Athletic Association Agreements
discussionItems.description: Seven athletic association agreements with proposed changes for Rush Union Soccer, Atlanta MABL, and Dunwoody Senior Baseball.

notes: Treetop Quest addressed safety incident concerns - company had been without incident for ten years prior
Charter amendments explained as not applying to current mayor and council but establishing policy framework
Council Member Harris recused herself from Charter Amendment discussion due to potential conflict
